tweet: Good news for Tampa Bay - #HurricaneDorian projected track continues to move east. Heavy rains and strong winds are still expected across the state, so please follow all official advisories and stay safe, Pinellas. https://twitter.com/TB_Times/status/1167833181615263744 …

Hurricane projections can change quickly. For up-to-the-minute forecasts and warnings, follow @NWSTampaBay and sign up for emergency weather alerts from the National Weather Service directly to your phone at the link below.  https://www.weather.gov/wrn/wea

The Pinellas Citizens Information Center is now OPEN. Operators are standing by to answer questions on storm preparation, shelters, local resources and more. Call (727) 464-4333 or download the Alert Pinellas app at the link below to stay informed ⬇️ https://twitter.com/PinellasCoNews/status/1167423983781916673 …

FEMA is working w/ Florida officials to prepare for #HurricaneDorian. NOW is the time to prepare: be sure to refill needed prescription medications, stock up on water and non-perishable food, fuel your car, and download the @FEMA app for weather alerts.  https://www.fema.gov/mobile-app

UPDATE: Sandbags are now available for Pinellas residents at locations in Largo, St. Petersburg, and Palm Harbor – click the link below for hours and location info ⬇️  http://go.activecalendar.com/pinellascounty/site/pressrelease/event/pinellas-update-pinellas-county-sandbag-operations/ …
